abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
A mechanism for displaying text or images in a view object without the overhead of a full
subclass.
Begins editing of the receiver’s text using the specified field editor.
Selects the specified text range in the cell’s field editor.
An object that contains information about an input action, such as a mouse click or a key press.
The view shown for a row in a table view.
A set of related records, displayed in rows that represent individual records and columns that represent the attributes of those records.
Edits the cell at the specified column and row using the specified event and selection behavior.
The index of the column being edited.
The index of the row being edited.
An array containing the current table column objects.
The infrastructure for drawing, printing, and handling events in an app.
A false value.
A true value.
Type to represent a Boolean value.
Describes an integer.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A signed integer value type.
